intro: Leptochilus hemionitideus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
